noun.description: The X-shaped structure formed at the point below the brain where the two optic nerves cross over each other.
A point at which paired chromosomes remain in contact during the first metaphase of meiosis, and at which crossing over and exchange of genetic material occur between the strands.

origin: Mid 19th century: modern Latin, from Greek chiasma crosspiece, cross-shaped mark, from khiazein mark with the letter chi.
